result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) and OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Valiant M. Green was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Valiant M. Green was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty Jay Pucek
Dated 6/15/22 - REVIEW of a decision of the Court of Appeals. Affirmed.
Dated 7/19/22 - IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed on June 15, 2022, that: The decision of the court of appeals is affirmed.
dated 01/06/22. IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. The defendant-appellant-petitioner's reply brief shall be filed on or before January 18, 2022
dated 11/17/21. IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. The state's response brief shall be served and filed on or before December 17, 2021. No further extensions of time will be granted

dated 09/30/21. IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. Defendant-appellant-petitioner's opening brief shall be served and filed on or before October 28, 2021. No further extensions of time will be granted.

dated 09/14/21. IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is granted and that pursuant to Wis. Stat. (Rule) 809.62(6), the defendant-appellant-petitioner may not raise or argue issues not set forth in the petition for review unless otherwise ordered by the court; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to Wis. Stat. (rules) 809.62(6) and 809.63, within 30 days after the date of this order and the defendant-appellant-petitioner must file a brief in this court; that within 20 days of filing the plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin, must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that if a brief is filed by the plaintiff-respondent within 10 days of filing the defendant-appellant-petitioner must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief or petition for review or response; instead, any material in these documents upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief filed in this court; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the first brief filed in this court must contain, as part of the appendix, a copy of the decision of the court of appeals in this case; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if a party has not previously filed an electronic copy of the briefs filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals, the party, within 30 days after the date of this order, must provide the clerk of this court with 10 copies of the brief previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals; but if the party has already filed an electronic copy of such briefs, then there is no obligation to provide additional copies of those briefs to the clerk of this court; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the allowance of costs, if any, in connection with the granting of the petition will abide the decision of this court on review.
Letter to Jay R. Pucek from Sheila Reiff
COA dated 3/31/21 Judgment of Circuit Court is summarily affirmed

PRELIMINARY
Count 1

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Deft stipulates to the (3) prior convictions as well as the BAC test result (.214).  Jurors reconvene @ 9:26am.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions given.  Opening statements.  Testimony commences.  State's witnesses - Nancy T., Det. Mark Poffenberger.  Exhibits #S1, D4, & D5 offered/received.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes.  Testimony continues - P.O. Arnold, & P.O. Daniel Sorenson.  Deft stipulates to exhibit #2 (blood draw results).  State rests @ 11:12am.  Court takes a short recess to confer w/deft; jurors excused from court room.  Defense moves to dismiss; denied by the Court.  Deft wishes to testify; colliquey conducted with deft.  Jurors reconvene.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from Valiant Green.  Defense exhibit #3 offered/received.  Defense rests @ 11:41am.  No rebuttal case.  Jurors excused for lunch; to return @ 1:15pm.  Court reconvenes @ 1:20pm.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:30pm.  Final instructions given.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror - Vian C.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 2:10pm.  Verdict reached @ 2:28pm.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 2:48pm.  Deft found guilty on counts 1 & 3.  Jury polled.  Jurors released @ 2:52pm.  State moves for judgment on count 3 & dismissal on count 1; Defense requests court w/hold ruling on entry of judgment.  Court grants the State's motion - judgment of guilt entered on count 3; count 1 is dismissed.  Court orders an updated PSI only; i.e. record check & deft's performance during his incarceration.  Sentencing set for 12/10/18 @ 11:30am.  Deft may participate in the update by telephone since he resides in Minnesota.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus & Law student David Olson appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner & Atty Carl Johnson.  Voir dire commences @ 10:20am; jury selected @ 11:39am.  Defense moves for a Batson challenge; brief arguments heard.  Motion denied by the Court.  Unselected jurors released for the day.  Few preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Jurors released for the day @ 11:50pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 10/9/18.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Deft objects to the State's request for adjournment.  Discussion held.  Court grants the State's request.  Deft moves to dismiss.  Court takes no action on deft's motion to dismiss.  Court grants the State's motion to adjourn.  JS adj to 10/8/18 @ 9am.
Telephone conference on August 8, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:46am.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Jury sworn.  Opening statement given by the State.  Defense reserves opening statement.  Testimony commences - Nancy T., P.O. Mark Poffenberger, P.O. Warren Arnold, P.O. Daniel Sorenson.  Parties stipulate to the results of the blood draw.  Exhibits #1, #2, & #3 offered and received.  State rests @ 11:26am.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Defense moves to dismiss.  State objects.  Motion denied.  Jurors reconvene.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from Valiant Green.  Defense rests @ noon.  Jurors released for lunch @ noon; instructed to return @ 1:15pm.  Court reconvenes @ 1:15pm.  Closing arguments given.  Final instructions.  Alternate juror - Dean S.  Jury commences deliberations @ 2:01pm.  Verdict reached @ 3:28pm.  Jurors reconvene in the courtroom @ 3:29pm.  Deft found guilty on both counts.  Jury polled.  Jurors released @ 3:34pm.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Motion granted.  Bond is revoked.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/2/15 @ 2:30pm.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges
